revised_title: Wigner's Problem of Reflected Light Signals in de Sitter Space: A Projective Model
tldr: The author presents a projective model for de Sitter space to study the behavior of light signals and world lines of material bodies. The model uses the real projective plane outside a given conic to represent events, lines, and intervals. The author explores different scenarios of world lines, such as ultra-parallel, intersecting, and parallel, and analyzes the behavior of reflected light signals in each case.
